qas.question: How many soldiers did Eisenhower ultimately send to Vietnam?
How many days did the President of South Vietnam visit the US for in 1957?
Where was a parade held for the President of South Vietnam?
Who was Secretary of State in 1957?
According to Dulles, why was Diem made president of Vietnam?

context: In the years that followed, Eisenhower increased the number of U.S. military advisors in South Vietnam to <a0_0>900<a0_0/> men. This was due to North Vietnam's support of "uprisings" in the south and concern the nation would fall. In May 1957 Diem, then President of South Vietnam, made a state visit to the United States for <a1_0>ten<a1_0/> days. President Eisenhower pledged his continued support, and a parade was held in Diem's honor in <a2_0>New York City<a2_0/>. Although Diem was publicly praised, in private Secretary of State <a3_0>John Foster Dulles<a3_0/> conceded that Diem had been selected because <a4_0>there were no better alternatives<a4_0/>.
